main_definition: To make or cause something to reach farther or longer, or to keep it in position for a longer time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To prolong the duration of an agreement, deadline, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: The company decided to extend the project deadline by one week.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make something reach a farther distance or length
meanings_and_examples.example: She extended her arm to reach for the book on the top shelf.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To add more items, features, etc., to increase size or quantity
meanings_and_examples.example: The restaurant decided to extend its menu by adding vegetarian and gluten-free options.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make an offer that someone can accept or reject, usually in a business context
meanings_and_examples.example: They extended their offer for the partnership with another company until the end of next month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Informal usage meaning to show patience or tolerance towards someone's actions or behavior
meanings_and_examples.example: She tried not to extend any judgment on his unconventional choices.
